Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2013 12:49PM - edited Feb 13, 2013 12:51PM by LunaTechChick Hello, I have not posted in this forum before. I am a 3 1/2 year survivor.  I have had several people ask me to share this link to my blog over here.  I thought I had, but apparently it was shared on another forum.  I hope this is the appropriate place & that it is permitted to share links to blogs with photos. Or should I have started a new topic?  I apologize, I didn't see a "Introduce Yourself" type of thread anywhere, but I'm sorta new to this site. Anyway, I had to have 2 lumpectomy surgeries (second to get the clear margin), then TCH chemo / Herceptin then radiation.  When I first was told I was gonna have chemo, the hair loss part really was the most traumatic part of the whole ordeal for me. So I searched & searched the internet for blogs & pics from others who were going through it or had already gone through it.  And the ones I found really did help.  So I did one on my blog, & thought I'd share it with y'all here.  Hope it might help others who are havin a hard time with the hair loss part of treatment.  So here's the link: http://lunatechchick.blogspot.com/2011/12/all-this-hairy-businessorhow-long-will.html   Feel free to share the blog/post with anyone you think might find it helpful, or bring a smile when they see my mohawk! =) So, after numerous messages from people telling me this post should be shared here, it is now.  If this is not the right place, or if I should have started a New Topic, just let me know & I'll correct or whatever is the right thing to do. :)    I used Aveda hair products before the bc, on my bald head, & still use it.  :)
